thread.title: Obama celebrates American music with ‘eclectic bunch’
thread.title_full: Obama celebrates American music with ‘eclectic bunch’

author: STACY A. ANDERSON
title: Obama celebrates American music with ‘eclectic bunch’
text:
Obama celebrates American music with ‘eclectic bunch’ Originally published October 14, 2015 at 9:35 pm President Barack Obama walks onto the stage in the East Room of the White House in Washington at the beginning of the “In Performance at the White House” series, Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2015. This event, “A Celebration of American Creativity” will celebrate the 50th anniversary of the National Foundation on the Arts and the Humanities Act. (AP Photo/Susan Walsh) Three-time American Grammy Award-winning blues musician Keb’ Mo’ performs in the East Room of the White House in Washington at the beginning of the “In Performance at the White House” series, Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2015. This event, “A Celebration of American Creativity,” will celebrate the 50th anniversary of the National Foundation on the Arts and the Humanities Act. (AP Photo/Susan Walsh) Three-time American Grammy Award-winning blues musician Keb’ Mo’ performs in the East Room of the White House in Washington at the beginning of the “In Performance at the White House” series, Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2015. This event, “A Celebration of American Creativity,” will celebrate the 50th anniversary of the National Foundation on the Arts and the Humanities Act. (AP Photo/Susan Walsh) Three-time American Grammy Award-winning blues musician Keb’ Mo’ performs in the East Room of the White House in Washington at the beginning of the “In Performance at the White House” series, Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2015. This event, “A Celebration of American Creativity,” will celebrate the 50th anniversary of the National Foundation on the Arts and the Humanities Act. (AP Photo/Susan Walsh) 0 of 0 By STACY A. ANDERSON The Associated Press 
WASHINGTON (AP) — Bopping his head to the beat and swaying to a blues version of “America the Beautiful,” President Barack Obama on Wednesday night celebrated what he called one of the country’s most precious gifts: “American creativity.” 
Obama and his wife, Michelle, marked the history of American music during the latest installment of the PBS television program “In Performance at the White House.” The president also noted the 50th anniversary of the National Endowment for the Arts and the Humanities. 
“Creativity, it’s always played a central role in the life of our nation,” Obama said. “It’s our artists who hold up a mirror to our society, reminding us of our common purpose and our collective obligations.” 
Obama said American music is grounded in stories of real people and that lyrics share the tales of hometowns and the hood, love and heartbreak. Most Read Stories
